title: R40173
content: The financial crisis of 2007-2008 escalated despite efforts to restore calm. By early 2009, the global economy was in a descending spiral, with policy focused on preventing a prolonged downturn. The origins of financial crises and their containment mechanisms are being questioned. The causes of the current crisis will likely be debated for years to come. This report presents factors identified as causes of the crisis in tabular form. The financial crisis of 2007-2008 escalated despite efforts to restore calm.
